# Pie charts {#sec-pie-charts} ::: {.callout-tip appearance='simple' icon=false} ***This graph is largely complete and just needs final proof reading.*** ::: :::: {.callout-note collapse="false" icon=false}
::: {.cell layout-align="right"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](pie_charts_files/figure-html/full_code_display-1.png){fig-align='right' width=60% height=60%} ::: ::: ::: {style="font-size: 1.10em; color: #02577A;"} **This graph requires:** ::: ::: {style="font-size: 1.05em; color: #282b2d;"} **✅ a categorical variable** ::: :::: ## Description *“In general, pie charts work well when the goal is to emphasize simple fractions, such as one-half, one-third, or one-quarter.”* *“They also work well when we have very small datasets.”* - [Claus O. Wilke, Fundamentals of Data Visualization (2019)](https://clauswilke.com/dataviz/) Pie-charts are ideal for comparing the proportions of categorical variable values, and we can build pie-charts using the [`ggpubr` package.](https://rpkgs.datanovia.com/ggpubr/) ## Set up ::: {style="font-size: 1.15em; color: #1e83c8;"} **PACKAGES:** ::: Install packages. ::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="show"} install.packages("ggpubr") library(ggpubr) install.packages("ggplot2movies") library(ggplot2movies) library(ggplot2) ``` ::: ::: ::: {style="font-size: 1.15em; color: #1e83c8;"} **DATA:** ::: ::: {.column-margin} ![](www/imdb.png){fig-align="right" width="35%" height="35%"} ::: Remove the missing values and `"NC-17"` from `mpaa` and summarise the count and percent. ::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="show"} movie_pie <- ggplot2movies::movies |> filter(mpaa != "" & mpaa != "NC-17") |> group_by(mpaa) |> summarise(cnt = n()) |> mutate( perc = round(cnt / sum(cnt), 3), mpaa = factor(mpaa, levels = c("PG", "PG-13", "R"))) glimpse(movie_pie) #> Rows: 3 #> Columns: 3 #> $ mpaa PG, PG-13, R #> $ cnt 528, 1003, 3377 #> $ perc 0.108, 0.204, 0.688 ``` ::: ::: ## Grammar ::: {style="font-size: 1.15em; color: #1e83c8;"} **CODE:** ::: - Create labels with `labs()` - Initialize the graph with `ggplot()` and provide `data` - Assign `"perc"` to `x` - Assign `labs` to `label` - Assign `"in"` to `lab.pos` - Assign `"white"` to `lab.font` and `color` - Assign `"mpaa"` to `fill` - Remove legend with `theme(legend.position = "none")` ::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="show"} labs <- paste0(movie_pie$mpaa, " (", (100*movie_pie$perc), "%)") labs_pie <- labs( title = "Percent MPAA ratings for IMDB movies", x = "Percent MPAA rating") ggp2_pie <- ggpubr::ggpie(movie_pie, x = "perc", label = labs, lab.pos = "in", lab.font = "#ffffff", fill = "mpaa", color = "#ffffff") + theme(legend.position = "none") ggp2_pie + labs_pie ``` ::: ::: ::: {style="font-size: 1.15em; color: #1e83c8;"} **GRAPH:** ::: ::: {.cell .column-page-inset-right layout-nrow="1"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](pie_charts_files/figure-html/create_graph_pie-1.png){width=100% height=100%} ::: :::
